title: File object
description: Description of a file. File objects describe content from which a problem arises. Although the file may be also valid and have no error object referring to it.

source.description: Identifier for the source classifying the file.

wellFormed.description: Should the file validate as well-formed. 'null' value equals to undetermined. 'virtual' value refers to virtual or dummy files that will never have a location but connect an error to a file format.

checksum.description: Checksums of the content in the locations. Two checksums are used to mitigate checksum collisions. The other is faster and the other is more reliable.

md5.description: MD5 checksum of the data in the locations.

blake2b.description: BLAKE2b checksum of the data in the locations.

location.description: List of objects with a label as the key and a free form description of the source location as the value. Locations may be URIs (URL preferred), relative file paths or instructions on how to ask for the file.

([a-zA-Z-]){3,30}.description: Location such as path or URL, for example.

metadata.description: File scraper output of streams in a file for corpus documentation.
